_comment: Created by NCODowd on 16/11/2016 17:22:37 using v2.7
title: How many elective operations have been cancelled and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary:
The number of cancelled elective operations fluctuates over time from quarter to quarter, but in any given financial year there are peaks in Q4. This is likely due to hospitals dealing with winter pressures.

However, the overall trend is that there has been an increase in the number of cancelled elective operations. There were 8,714 more cancelled elective operation in Q4 2014/15 than Q4 of 1994/95 - this represents a 60% increase over 20 years.

Updated November 2016.
